summary: Bryggen , also known as Tyskebryggen , is a series of Hanseatic commercial buildings found on the eastern side of the fjord coming into Bergen, Norway.
full_text:
Bryggen , also known as Tyskebryggen , is a series of Hanseatic commercial buildings lining the eastern side of the fjord coming into Bergen, Norway. Bryggen has since 1979 been on the UNESCO list for World Cultural Heritage sites.
The city of Bergen was founded around 1070 within the original boundaries of Tyskebryggen. Around 1360 a Kontor of the Hanseatic League was established there, and Tyskebryggen became the centre of the Hanseatic commercial activities in Norway. Today, Bryggen houses museums, shops, restaurants and pubs.
title: Bryggen
